%% To set up a local environment to build the paper in OS X, use the following commands:
%%   NOTE: requires wget (to install on OS X see 
%%   http://code.google.com/p/rudix/downloads/detail?name=wget-1.12-0.dmg)
%%   1) mkdir meng-thesis && cd meng-thesis
%%   2) wget http://web.mit.edu/dbetser/Public/1122/build_thesis.sh # this will allow
%%      us to make updates to the Makefile
%%   3) chmod u+x ./build_thesis.sh
%%   4) ./build_thesis.sh  # This will download the Makefile, build the pdf,
%%                                   # and open it in the Preview app.


%% The documentclass options along with the pagestyle can be used to generate
%% a technical report, a draft copy, or a regular thesis.  You may need to
%% re-specify the pagestyle after you \include  cover.tex.  For more
%% information, see the first few lines of mitthesis.cls. 


%\documentclass[12pt,vi,twoside]{mitthesis}
%%
%%  If you want your thesis copyright to you instead of MIT, use the
%%  ``vi'' option, as above.
%%
%\documentclass[12pt,twoside,leftblank]{mitthesis}
%%
%% If you want blank pages before new chapters to be labelled ``This
%% Page Intentionally Left Blank'', use the ``leftblank'' option, as
%% above. 


\documentclass[12pt,twoside]{mitthesis}
\usepackage{lgrind}
\pagestyle{plain}


%% This bit allows you to either specify only the files which you wish to
%% process, or `all' to process all files which you \include.
%% Krishna Sethuraman (1990).


%% Commenting out the type-in portion so that it can be compiled by script without input.
%%\typein [\files]{Enter file names to process, (chap1,chap2 ...), or `all' to
%%process all files:}
%%\def\all{all}
%%\ifx\files\all \typeout{Including all files.} \else \typeout{Including only \files.} \includeonly{\files} \fi


\begin{document}


\include{cover}
\pagestyle{plain}
\include{contents}
\include{chap1}
\appendix
\include{appa}
\include{appb}
\include{biblio}
\end{document}
